channel.title: Going for a new build
channel.description:
My new build so far:
[img]http://i52.tinypic.com/1087jp4.png[/img]
EDIT: Ditched the hexa-core and went for a top of the line sandy bridge.
EDIT2: That's what I'm at now, motherboard is http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813130574 just sold out atm, any final suggestions before I order it?

item.title: Going for a new build
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote="(Anthony), post:20, topic:385597"][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=481347.msg3550852#msg3550852 date=1301516357]
WEI stops being relevant after the 5’s and 6’s. It doesn’t provide benchmarks that are all that useful as they don’t really translate proper into real-world performance.

Its more of, how well Windows will run more than anything. You want to be doing more than just that, right?
[/quote]
Could you perhaps provide me with better tools for testing then?[/quote]
3dmark vantage
WPrime (< i really only use this once I overclock my cpu for testing stability/temps)

Read full topic

item.title: Going for a new build
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

pcmark
3dmark
Heaven DX11 Benchmark (See how you handle some intense tessellation on your DX11 cards)

Check the hardware review sites to see what they benchmark with, there are plenty. But these are certainly more useful than WEI in regards to gaming and in the case of PCMark more general PC stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Going for a new build
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Thanks for posting that, it makes me feel like I got a super-excellent deal on my computer upgrade:

This is my build (with ASUS mobo):
http://www.moparisthebest.com/builds/moparisthebest.html

So, with rebates, I spent a total of about $300 for the entire thing, you spent more than that on just your CPU.

You:
CPU: 328.99
8gb ram: 99.99
mobo: 179.99
Total: 608.97

Me:
CPU: 129.99
8gb ram: 79.99 (+ free $7 flash drive)
mobo: 99.99
Total: 309.97

And with half the money you spent, your scores on CPU and memory are only marginally better. I’m actually surprised how well my ancient 8800 GTS did in the graphics test, I’ll upgrade that later. Your hard disk is much better than my ancient SATA1 drive too, I reserve my better, newer, faster hard drives for Linux, which I use all the time.

Read full topic

item.title: Going for a new build
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:11, topic:385597”][quote author=Radeon link=topic=481347.msg3525002#msg3525002 date=1299725949]

Oh yeah, the sandy bridge issues was resolved.

Are you sure about that?
[/quote]

I’m fairly sure yeah. I do believe Intel when they say they had already found and implemented the fix before they started the recall to ensure restocking was as quick as possible.[/quote]
Oh right. For some reason when I read “resolved” I thought there was some non-hardware solution.

Read full topic

item.title: Going for a new build
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

Thug-life:

Oh yeah, the sandy bridge issues was resolved. Though, I find it funny that you would complain about the price of the GPU yet you’d be willing to spend all that on a CPU, when you’d likely see more for your money in that GPU and a top end Sandy bridge CPU.

I don’t really mind the price they are just all sold out on newegg + I don’t play any games my old 8800 GTX can’t handle.

Read full topic

item.title: Going for a new build
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

Thug-life:

Get rid of that 990x. Its a brilliant CPU, but completely unnecessary for the price, go for the top end sandy bridge CPU and you’ll get just as much value for a quarter of the price.

Yeah that’s what I was thinking about, but I read reviews about some of the Sandy Bridge CPUs being fucked up, is that resolved now?
Also: what about the AMD Phenom hexa-cores?

[quote=“Baros Rocks, post:3, topic:385597”]http://www.guru3d.com/article/radeon-hd-6990-review/

:P[/quote]
Expensive as hell + they are all out of stock on newegg and I don’t feel like buying parts from multiple places.

Read full topic

item.title: Going for a new build
item.dc:creator: @Baros_Rocks Baros Rocks
item.description:
@Baros_Rocks wrote:

Guru3D.com

Radeon HD 6990 review

For many weeks now the Radeon HD 6990 has been a product of much discussion. Nobody really could confirm what GPU's would be used, how much graphics memory it would get and so on. Well, rest assured. AMD stuck two Cayman XT GPUs (R6970) onto the PCB...

Read full topic
